name: Berry–Robbins problem
summary: The Berry–Robbins problem is a question in mathematics about whether a continuous map exists between two specific mathematical spaces—the configuration space of \(n\) points in 3D space and the flag manifold \(U(n)/T^{n}\)—that respects the symmetries of the spaces. This problem arose from an attempt by Berry and Robbins to generalize their work on the spin-statistics theorem for \(n\) particles and was solved positively by Michael Atiyah, who proved the existence of such a map.
